page.title: 12The pigs at Chasepool Farm
page.content: The pigs are kept in bacon houses. After the sow has been with the boar it takes four months for the piglets to be born. After they are born piglets have their tails cut to stop them biting them and their teeth out to stop them biting the sow when they are suckling. At three weeks they are moved to the weaning house and the sow goes back to the boar.The piglets are fed on skimmed k for the next four or five weeks. They then moved into the bacon house where they are fed on wet meal for a further eleven weeks. When they reach 90kg in weight they are sold for bacon.
